text: EABL snapped back today and ended the day 4% up.   Relief.
EABL won't collapse under my watch .

EABL CFO on the impact of the requirement to remit excise duty within 24 hours:   "We've been quite open with the policymakers in saying this is extremely problematic administratively...It's not increasing the amount of collection  so it's a zero-sum game & it needs to stop"

I watched Julians Amboko interview EABL chief of finance and man! The government wants to be paid excise duty 24 hours after stocks leave the warehouse. This government wants to kill Kenyan companies completely mazee.

Why EABL crashed 15% on Friday.  Reasons :  KRA requires EABL to submit excise duty every 24 hours .  EABL is forced to borrow from local banks to sort out KRA   This is eating operating cash and revenues .   Dividends will be slashed for now to the future .
EABL's unaudited financials tell the brutal story of the absolutely HOSTILE business environment Kaunda King and His Merry Men have produced after 14 months of seemingly perpetual amateur hour
